title: Faith, Doubt, and Contact
summary: Contact remains a unique movie due to its representation of science. It remains a great film due to the treatment of doubt and faith as a universal aspect of human existence.

title: Job Opening: Host/Producer, Planetary Radio
summary: The Planetary Society is looking for a host/producer of Planetary Radio.

title: A Personal Message to Planetary Radio Listeners
summary: Planetary Radio host Mat Kaplan has an announcement for listeners.

title: SBIRS GEO 6: Atlas V to complete SBIRS constellation
summary: Continuing as the launch vehicle of choice to deploy one of the U.S. Space Force's highest priority satellite systems, United Launch Alliance (ULA) is configuring an Atlas V 421 to launch the sixth Space Based Infrared System Geosynchronous Earth Orb...

title: Chandrayaan-1, India’s first Moon mission
summary: The orbiter discovered water on the Moon, and kickstarted an ambitious Indian planetary science program.

title: See JWST's amazing first science images
summary: These are some of the first science images from NASA's James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), released on July 12, 2022.

title: See JWST’s first deep field image
summary: Bill Nye's reflections on the first deep field image from NASA's JWST mission.

title: JWST versus Hubble: How are they different?
summary: Unlike Hubble, JWST was primarily designed to see the universe in infrared light, revealing ancient galaxies, peering through nebulae, and uncovering exoplanet atmospheres.

title: Breaking new ground
summary: Whether it’s a mission, a policy decision, or an individual person, sometimes all it takes is one thing to change the way we explore.
